result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M. Fenton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Must follow all rules of Probation.
Concurrent with: 15CF472/16CF14

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. If not paid at the end of Probation may be reduced to a civil judgment as long as there was good faith effort to pay.

$8,002.18 restitution to be paid to Probation while on Probation for David Madison. If not paid by the end of Probation, may be reduced to a civil judgment as long as there is good faith effort to pay. Bond to be applied to Restitution.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

No elective office. No voting until civil rights are restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or loss of other civil rights until restored. No contact with David Madison unless permission from Probation. No illegal substances.
Must provide a DNA sample, no surcharge.
Must complete an AODA assessment and compliance.

timeConds.notes:
Subject to work release. NOT subject to good time. Credit of 176 days if revoked.
Concurrent with: 15CF472/16CF14

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Absolute Sobriety.
No illegal drugs.
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Any outstanding financial obligations are to be paid through the Department of Corrections while on supervision.  Defendant to pay $50.00 per month if employed once released.  Failure to pay may result in warrant, tax intercept, license suspension and/or civil judgment.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Eligible for expungment upon successful completion of Probation.  Must petition court.
Must undergo COMPAS evaluation and follow through with criminogenic needs as recommended by Probation.
May be discharged early from Probation if successfully completes Probation.
